intro: Tetragonotheca guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan tetragonotheca, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its quadrangular stems and palmate leaves with five lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
